agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
service_description: Provides a public preschool program combining education, nutrition, health, and social services for low-income families with children. Income guidelines may be waived for children with special needs or disabilities or other special circumstances. The program is delivered on a school-year basis at several locations. Transportation is provided when available and within set boundaries.
site_details: Call or visit the website for enrollment information and locations.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Classes: Vary; morning and afternoon classes available
site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, or Wabash County -- Age 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% federal poverty guidelines

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
service_description: Provides a comprehensive assessment to determine whether nursing home care placement is appropriate and provides information about area nursing home options. In order to receive Medicaid coverage, any person seeking placement in an Indiana nursing facility must complete a Pre-Admission Screening (PAS) evaluation.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an evaluation.
site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Seeking placement in a nursing home

site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- May be eligible for SNAP benefits (based on initial assessment, special circumstances, or at caller's request)

service_description: Offers free, objective information on Medicare, Medicare supplements, Medicare Advantage plans, Medicaid, long-term care insurance, and prescription assistance programs. SHIP counselors are trained and certified by the Indiana Department of Insurance.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- People who are or will soon become eligible for Medicare

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.
site_details: Call for an initial assessment and to be placed on a wait list. An in-home assessment will be scheduled when it is your turn on the wait list.
site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Age 60 or older, or any age or with disabilities -- Unable to perform tasks of daily living without assistance (based on assessment) -- Income requirements vary by funding source

service_description: Offers individual development savings accounts for low-income adults in the Wabash Valley area. Participants receive matching funds for money they save toward buying a home, paying for post-secondary education, or starting or expanding a small business.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; submit funds required to open the account.
site_eligibility: Living in Indiana -- With earned income (from full or part-time employment) -- Able to save a minimum of $50 per month -- At or below 200% of the federal poverty guidelines

agency_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
agency_desc: An Indiana Area Agency on Aging providing programs and services that benefit low income, disadvantaged, and older persons living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash Counties.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES
service_name: SENIOR FARMERS MARKET NUTRITION PROGRAM - CASS
service_description: Offers Farmers Market electronic dollars to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $50 in electronic funds that must be used within 30 days of distribution. There are limited slots available with a waitlist following distribution, awaiting funds becoming available after 30 days due to non-use.
site_details: Participants must complete a new application each fiscal year. -- Call to schedule an appointment or for available dates and times; (A list of participating markets is available on the market app, electronically only.) -- Participant may designate a proxy to apply for certification and purchase of produce.
site_schedule: Case and Howard Counties: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Tipton County: by appointment only)
site_eligibility: Living in the county where eligibility is being determined -- Age 60 or older -OR- Age 55 or older, person with disabilities that is living in housing for elderly and participating in a congregate nutrition service -- Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines, utilizing a confirmed agency service

service_description: Delivers hot, midday meals each weekday to homebound seniors and persons with disabilities living in the cities of Kokomo, Logansport, Peru, Rochester, Tipton, and Wabash. Frozen meals are available for clients who live in other regions of Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County. Meals may be paid by state and federal funds for clients who meet specific guidelines.
site_details: Call for an eligibility assessment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Meal Delivery: Mon-Fri noon
site_eligibility: Living in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County -- Hot meal delivery limited to Kokomo, Logansport, Peru, Rochester, Tipton, and Wabash -- Frozen meal delivery available to those living in other parts of service area -- Homebound due to age (60 and older) or disability

service_description: Provides weekly group meetings with information and support to help mothers cope with parenting challenges. Topics discussed include health, nutrition, budgeting, problem solving, child development, child guidance, parent development and use of community resources. Child care is available during the meeting. Transportation is provided when available and within city limits.
site_details: Call to confirm location(s), dates, and times.
site_eligibility: Parents or grandparents of children under age 5

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
site_name: AREA FIVE AGENCY ON AGING & COMMUNITY SERVICES - LOGANSPORT
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, and Wabash County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Cass, Fulton, Howard, Miami, Tipton, or Wabash County

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A not-for-profit, county-owned, regional medical center serving people in Cass County and north central Indiana.
service_description: Provides prenatal services and postpartum services up to one year after birth, including regular checkups with an OB/GYN, monthly telehealth or home visits with a registered nurse, education classes on various pregnancy related topics, and referrals to other community resources. agency_desc: A not-for-profit, county-owned, regional medical center serving people in Cass County and north central Indiana.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from a Logansport Memorial Hospital provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for financial assistance based on their income.
site_details: Call for more information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from a Logansport Memorial Hospital provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services) and having a low to moderate income.

agency_desc: A nonprofit community mental health center offering behavioral health and substance use treatment within north central Indiana.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Cass County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as radon, mosquitoes, and rodents. Conducts mold analysis and testing for lead, tap water, and soil contaminants.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 7am-4pm; Tues and Wed 7:30am-4:30pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Cass County

service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Cass County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, wells, public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as radon, mosquitoes, and rodents. Conducts mold analysis and testing for lead, tap water, and soil contaminants.

service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.

site_eligibility: Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity). Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.

site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Cass County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Cass County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Cass County
